caption: Worst service ever. We waited in there for our food for 30 minutes and there wasn’t anyone sitten. You should give priority to costumers that show up in your place.
Good food. waitress was very nice but service a bit slow due to lots of business. Very clean and great portions. Would get again.

My first time trying a chicken souvlaki sandwich and I got it for delivery! Very satisfied definitely will be ordering food there more often. once weather gets nicer will definitely head down there and eat with friends.

Very Rude woman at the cash register. Gyro was tasteless. Overrated. Better places around than here over priced as well. Louis Gyro on 77th and 3rd Ave is way better. Come to find out this is the son of Spartans restaurant that use to be on 8th Ave.      Would never come to this establishment again. Def not worth it.
Best place for Greek food!!
Food is delicious
Best souvlaki in brooklyn

Third time we ordered for pickup...food is ok but not worth the oney for the amount of food they give you. Second time we ordered they forgot some things and the salad was dry...I called and was transferred to an attitude-filled female...maybe the owner..this time and probably the last time, we also ordered a "large salad"...paid for a "large salad"...got a "small salad" in a "large" container. The best Greek place we used to dine at was Spartan's on 7th ave...great food..owner was a great guy but unfortunately they closed down...missed their hospitality...need to find a new place...
Delish

Picked up a pork gyro sandwich Saturday night. It tasted ok. But wasn’t worth $9.50. The little  meat that they give was so shredded It kept falling out of the pita, I thought I was eating a philly steak sandwich. I was looking forward to the French fries that come in the sandwich but there was only 4. 2 long and 2 short ones. I would be happier if they gave a nice portion. Thumbs down! I don’t mind paying the credit card fee but The customers shouldn’t  get taxed on that fee, it should be added after the tax.

I wanna start off by saying how delicious the food at this restaurant is but the reason why I gave it three stars is because of the female at the register. I purchased a lamb Gyro sandwich and requested for it to be cut in half she gave me a huge attitude when I asked for that simple request. When I told her I would like you to please cut it in half because it gets a little messy she said to me “you ask him to do it I don’t know how he’s going to do it, you ask him to do it he’s the one making your sandwich”  the man who did make my sandwich was so pleasant and said sure no problem. I think her customer service needs a lot of work. This is not the first time she had an attitude for no reason.
I gave three stars for their cleaniness and took two off for their food quality which has gone down . Fatty , greasy and drowned in lemon juice is not Greek food    unless it came from a food cart .
Delivery and food was excellent. Take out vendor adds 8.75% sales tax on tip when its added on credit card. Give tip in cash to  delivery person.
Great chicken souvlaki platter! Also, nice greek red wine, greek fries, roasted red pepper hummus, everything fresh & delish! Our server,  Nini, amazing service, can't do enuf for you, thank you!

Based on the good reviews, I came in expecting great food and service ! However, it was quite the opposite. The employees were rude and it created an extremely hostile and uncomfortable environment for myself and my partner. I ordered the lamb gyro and honestly it had no flavor and was a bit gross. And to top it off, there was a HAIR in my food. Wouldn’t recommend, definitely better restaurants in the area.

0/10 experience, came with my boyfriend the other day. food is overpriced and not worth paying the money AT ALL. i felt a racially targeted atmosphere towards me, felt very uncomfortable (although not uncommon in many places in bayridge). would never go here again and do not recommend it to anyone with tastebuds. somethingreek in bayridge is one of many superior greek places where you get better food for a better price and better service. DO NOT RECOMMEND!!

The food was okay. Nothing exceptional. I asked them to correct my order, they said they couldn't and they also said they didnt offer refund or anything like that. As a bonus, they tossed two small pita in my bag which wasn't what I asked for.Not coming back
I love their seasoning! Their chicken Cabob are delicious with grilled pita bread.
The pork souvlaki platter is absolutely delicious
Excellent consistent food. Perfectly flavored meats, and large family style portions.
Great classic food

Absolutely amazing experience. Food was sooooo good. Good portions as well. Took my leftovers home. Service was amazing. Our waiter was very kind and answered any questions we had. He even sampled us with various different sauces. They also are doing a really good job with the outdoor dining. The seating area is very pretty and the tables are spaced apart adequately. They also gave us disposable menus which I thought was a really smart way to protect against COVID. All employees wore masks. Will be coming again. 💯
Everything is delicious and fresh. Staff are very good and fast.

I gave this place a second chance, but I was disappointed yet again. The gyro tasted great don't get me wrong, but like the last time it was just too small. The portion was way to small for the money. Today I ordered a gyro from Something Greek and it was double the size. Give people their money's worth.
The chicken with bacon stick was so juicy! Other places in bay ridge offer over salted over cooked food but this one is better

The owner was rude, overcharged for the food, charged 20% over the price on the menu and then just had the explanation that price of meat went up. I tried to support this business during the Covid situation but wrongfully so. They don’t deserve it. The gyros are subpar. Better gyros around.
Incredible food! I highly recommend the chicken breast platter. Owner reached out once after an out of the ordinary situation leaving his personal number to make things right. Thank you Lampros!

We had a recent issue with an order and the owner personally reached out to me to show how professional his establishment is. He apologized and owned up for his staff being inappropriate. He definitely made it up to us in the end by giving me his personal phone number and allowed me to text him an order when I wanted. The food has always been good here and I will continue to give them my business. Lampros is the man!
Astoria landmark for Greek delicacies and of course the souvlaki.

This restaurant was our go to Restaurant for delivery every week. This was the best Greek food around and we only wanted to give them business Especially during this tough time. Just try to place an order for delivery and the person who answered the phone was extremely rude and gave us an attitudeAnd stated even know we Have deliver to you in the past we will no longer deliver to you. When I asked him the reason he gave us an attitude and stated there was no specific reason.

It's an okay place. I find that their salads with lettuce are not that good. Their chicken it's fine. Waiters are very welcoming and professional. Compared to Blue Door and Something Greek, this restaurant could do better. It's unfortunate because the environment is cool when dining there.

"King Souvlaki" is conveniently located at the corner of 84th Street and 3rd Avenue in Bayridge Brooklyn NY. It's a small cozy Restaurant specializing in a variety of Greek gyros, like chicken,  pork, lamb, beef etc. A good number of delicious appetizers, soups and salads. They also serve wine and beer. If you are visiting NYC stop by King Souvlaki...it's a popular place for locals.Their prices are also very reasonable.

My coworker and I felt very uncomfortable with their customer service. We didn't not feel welcomed at all. If I was a owner I would  welcome people from all walks of life money is green at the end of the day.
We love you King Souvlaki. Niko a little bit more!
“ Avgolemono - Egg Lemon Chicken Soup like Grandma used to make”  Grandma makes it with orzo and chicken.  Onions instead of orzo and no chicken.

Better than the other bay ridge options. Food delivered is mostly  on point, not soggy or cold, just hot and right from the kitchen. It doesn't sit on the counter waiting 30 minutes, they are fast, efficient and it's worth a try really. I mean the store has a history which i like that whole angle, but can they keep up with the true greeks in the area.  I need to see something more in bay ridge, all the Greek restaurants are "meh".. They are either fast food, or play it to be fine dining when the quality of Costco chicken can be smelled from down the block, so your not fooling those who know.
Great Food
The service and staff is awesome and food is delicious when you get a chance to dine and eat!!!!!!

I'm VERY PICKY and most of the places I've been in bay ridge sucks. I'm not Greek but I'm addicted to the food from this place!! I've ordered delivery a couple times as I've been to the restaurant and I think the food is amazing!!!! Fresh, good price and it comes with a lot of meat. This place is my 4yo fav spot now. Give this place a try and I am sure you will become a regular customer!!! I'm glad I found this place!  *suggestion: the place only sells soda for kids and soda is a no no in my house. Please sell some juice so I can sit with my kid in the restaurant!
Relaxed atmosphere and delicious food
The best souvlaki you can get in the city ..
Great ambience... awesome food ... pricing is $$ ... Family friendly service ...
Better fast food.......I'll be back
Always delicious, always kind, always 5-star service!
Great service was provided and fast. The staff is very kind
Excellent everything. Generous portions. Delicious deliciousness. Friendly staff. Fun decor. Grab to go or sit and enjoy!
Love, love, love this place.  The food was fresh and amazing. The service was welcoming,   friendly and attentive.  The location was a beautiful industrial chic. Will definitely be returning.
Food is consistently  delicious,great service  and friendly atmosphere

Howdy pardners! Went here on the recommendation of a Greek local (I'm a non Greek Staten Islander). Parking sucked but it's Bay Ridge. The guys behind the back were friendly and said we could sit anywhere. Plenty of seating, including outdoor seats, with more on the 84th street side so it wasn't as busy. We sat inside by the window. Server was helpful. Food came out fast. Nice portions. We started the roasted pepper hummus. Great flavor, and everything came with pita chips so we had an abundance of that. The horiatiki salad was your classic Greek salad. No lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, wedges of feta. There were capers but.. I could have done without. That's my preference and next time I'll ask for it without. Something notable is it was a little light on the dressing but all the flavors came from the onions and tomatoes. And capers... We got the Greek fries. I don't know how but Mos tof the feta actually stuck to the fries. A nice touch compared to other places just sprinkling feta after the fact and it ending up on the bottom of the basket. Still had feta on the bottom, but there were some nice fries with feta melted on it. I had a kotobacon stick. That was tasty and flavorful. I was somewhat annoyed when another customer asked that their food not be cooked around pork or bacon. When they were told that would be difficult because pork and bacon are cooked on the grill the woman asked they try their best. I'm glad they came to somewhat of a compromise but if you have dietary restrictions you should also be mindful of the places you go. But it's your money... I had the lamb beef platter with rice and my girlfriend had a chicken gyro. Both good. The platter came with salad already (Argh! I always order salads that I could get for free) and the meat and rice were seasoned well. The gyro had fries in it. Am I the only one that thinks fries in sandwiches and rolls and the like is literally filler? Overall I liked it. Prices were fair. One last thing since it's on my mind, the plates and stuff were really cool. Hefty and could take a beating. As a final note, I gave it a 4 because the food was good and service was great but I wouldn't drive out here just for this place. That's partially laziness. And partially because I could get the same quality nearby. A 4 is still a good rating. A lot of people think they're 5s and are actually 2s so let's not overthink things.
Great Greek food, polite staff!!!!!

(Translated by Google) Very nice shop with great food. Very good prices, polite, pleasant staff !!!  (Original) Πολύ ωραίο μαγαζι με εξαιρετικό φαγητό.Πολυ καλές  τιμές ,ευγενικό , ευχάριστο προσωπικό !!!
The food is great ,I got my platter over lemon potatoes and I loved it!!! Highly recommended!!! The stuff was great too!!
Nice sit-down place. Good lamb, halloumi, and bread. Fries were a bit more oily than I like but maybe it was an off day.
Excellent Greek street food! Niko the waiter is excellent!
Excellent food and service

Holy cow! I was in town visit with some friends and they brought is here. The food was amazing! The staff was very friendly and the place was very clean.  Great price for the amount of food we ordered.
The food, sauces, and atmosphere are great!
Good food, reasonably priced

I went for lunch at 12pm with my family, And the doors were locked I knocked the gentleman unlocks the doors and I ask are you open? He says yes!!! And slamming the doors close meanwhile I’m with two babies and 5 people not welcoming not a nice person! We sit we get drinks with no ice the saganaki (fried cheese) was dry ! This place not very welcoming I wouldn’t advise anyone to go....NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!!
Whatever is fried in this place you feel the taste of the oil that is over used
Only issue is that they charge extra for credit card. Fact only mentioned near the register
Simple, healthy, reliable and affordable. You should feel good after eating Greek food, and here you will.
Sorry for that but I hope with my Review to get improve . The pork gyro was so dry it T was impossible to chew . I'm sorry I m  Greek but it was horrible. Something has to be done.

Unbelievable food today. Hands down one of  the best Chicken Souvlaki platters. I had ordered 2 platter's with lemon potatoes and salad.Everything in that platter was out  of this world. The portion was Hugh and plentiful.The  deliverycame with in 30 minutes of me ordering and I could hear they were extremely busy..  I would highly recommend King Souvlaki of Bayridge and  i hope they can  keep up serving great food and service.. Thank you for a great meal tonight
good Greek street food, I enjoyed the gyros more than the shish kabobs. good for a quick lunch or a fast meal to go. truthfully, exactly what you'd expect.
Great food. Quite authentic. Recommend the king platter. Get a taste of everything.

Many other folks posted about the service being mediocre so let's move to the next issue.  The 4% service charge that appears if you use a credit card. It appears before you even stipulated you were paying with card, so if you're paying cash you're supposed to do math I guess? Sure we got phone calcs. Make sure you read your check.  That's not enough for 2 stars, but the lack of noticeable air conditioning is one. I get it, 90f and humid. But because of this there's flies everywhere landing on /everything/. It's unsanitary. Especially as the food was open to the air and flies behind the counter.  This is all easily changeable, but what's not is the dry meat. Also the smaller portions vs the pix on Yelp. The pita was fresh, the tzatziki was bland, the salad was sparse. The spinach pie had a few layers of fyllo, and it was super dry and tough. The filling didn't taste fresh at all.
Good lamb gyro and large portions.one of our group  thought the lamb gyro was not as good as our usual place in Astoria.  No lamb souvlaki though. Chicken gyro and pork gyro which are less common.
Good food and good surroundings
Nice plase.Good chease and other products .Very frendly people. Spok couple different  lengviches. It is helpfull. I Recomend this store.
I was their two days ago and I ordered 1 chicken and 1 lamb gyro. Food was amazing. Definitely fresh food just like something Greek in bay ridge . Very comparable
Gyro platter. Very good.
Very good food...my only complaint is that it is way too hot in there.
Real authentic Greek cusine food was delicious.
Awesome Food..Best Greek salad around..

I am a native Bklyn person born and raised here the atmosphere service and gfood was amazing and even better reasonably priced I had the beef and lamb gyro and the Greek fried cheese as an appetizer and the owner gave me a complimentary dessert of his homemade Greek yogurt and cured grapes and honey drizzled on top of it it was like heaven on earth and I will definitely be going back again 🌈😊💖

This place passes through all debit and credit card fees to the customer, instead of the business owner paying them. This is not the case with almost every other business on the planet. They don't even tell you about it until you see it pop up on the register as a "service charge". It only comes out to 56 cents or so on top of your order, but it is the deceptive principle behind it that makes me SMH. All other businesses (even small local ones) have either a debit or credit minimum to make it profitable to sell their products using a card, without shadily passing the fee on to the customers, and only when you get to the register. I asked the employee at the register about it, and he only replied "they don't want to pay for it". Yeah, guess what, customers don't want to pay for it either, we're already paying inflated prices for your food. The food is pretty decent, nothing to write home about. But the fact that these shady, underhanded practices of nickle-and-diming customers for using a card is unacceptable, they should be ashamed. At the very least, they should be up-front about charging you, the customer, extra money for the "privilege" of using a debit or credit card. What is this, 1985 and most people pay for food with cash?
Best Gyro spot in Bay Ridge area. Must stop by. They also have great greeek fries. Must come and check them out.... Great staff, kind and attentive..
Greek home made berger
Loved this place.great staff. we had kings small plate - good for 4 people if you add a salad. will def be back!
Perfect everything
So this gyro platter costs 15$ unbelievably small portion...
The food here is pretty good. Large portions and good tasting.
amazing food and friendly staff !!
Best souvlaki in Bay ridge
Hands down Beat Gyros!!!!

You really shouldn't be able to F up souvlaki ...  and yet , it commonly is .... great food , good service , one peice of constructive criticism,  make more lemon potatoes for weekends and dont over salt the pita!  I love a little sea salt,  but the tomatoes in the salad and the plain order of pita were heavy handed ... now please guys.... Every Greek restaurant opens and after a year they do not remain consistent ,  stay on top of your game or you will end up like some other Greek restaurants in the neighborhood !  To the owners , stay on top of your kitchen or this will end up another business that does in bay ridge .  TRUST ME.
The food was ok. Seevice was slow, maybe because I set a bit on the side.

I was so excited to try King souvlaki. What a disappointment that was. The place was almost empty. We ordered a spanakopita wich was good and an augolemono soup which also was good. The souvlakia on the other hand were just terrible. The meat was dry and burned and about half of it was solid fat! The service was also a joke. They were 15 employees going in and out with  Frappe and cigarettes but we got a glass of water after asking for the bill. The cherry on top was a service charge.!
Love the Lamb Gyros.
Very good food
Loved the food! The serving plates were sweet and modern too.  Bring your appetite.
Customer friendly,  good food, reasonably priced , service is great.

Good people, great food . Sat at our table and watched all the delicious meats being prepared for our table had souvlaki, gyro ,and portobello for my vegetarian daughter she couldn't stop talking about how great it was,that's great when a meat geared restaurant takes the time to make a great vegetarian meal thanks to everyone involved

Dropped down one star last even thought I’m a huge fan of this place it’s a little too salty for my taste.  And I don’t like the fact that they cook the fries in EVO, it’s not safe to cook at high temperatures with EVO.
Good food
Frist time there the best in town thank you
Came in, waited for 5 (sic!) minutes at the door. With about 5-6 waiters, some of them doing nothing, no one bothered to talk to me. Not the kind of service I'm looking for.

Their food is amazing no doubt, BUT service is exact opposite. First time I went service was good I guess manager/owner was in good mood. Second, third and final time which brings me to this review, the service is horrible. They have bunch of high schoolers who stand right in front of your table chatting and talking completely ignoring the customer for any type of need. Took us 15 mins to order and all 7-8 workers were standing in a circle just talking. And when we stated can someone take our order the response was even more discomforting. I felt unwelcomed and frankly money wasted, I don’t care how good your food is. Any succesful customer service place knows that you can easily turn one bad experience to amazing but this place workers went extra mile to make it worst.

I ordered chicken gyro platter to go Very tasty big portion BUT most of the chicken was dry,not freshly sliced off the gyro machine/ rotisserie Is it because it was a to go order? Otw,nice lay out ,nice staff
Very, very nice!!
Oh definitely more then 5 star's delicious ,clean and fresh food but the waiter was very nice and professional bravo
Good Food, Great Atmosphere, Superb Service!!
Nice Greek food at reasonable prices

I came here last week with some friends and we were really happy with the food. Great service, and amazing food just like the food trucks. The restaurant has a really great vibe and the waitress was really friendly. Looking forward to trying literally everything on their menu.
Great service  and delicious, juicy souvlakia
Great food and value for your buck.
Great food. Great people. Authentic gyros and souvlaki like you get in Greece.

Wow, I mean how do people not tell others about this place? My lady was giving this for lunch at work, and brought some home. The chicken was so tasty, we sat down and the staff is not only professional but warm and friendly. I actually forgot to take pictures until after I had mostly eaten, I ordered a pork shiskabob, my lady chicken with bacon (forgot name sorry), fries which the website raved about (excellent!) Then we each had a chicken gyro, truly delicious and I would highly recommend eating here. I feel food should have taste and flavor, this place is amazing. For those that like hot sauce they had some red bottle on the table and I had assumed it may be like Franka res hot (mostly salty spice), but instead was treated to a very hot but not over powering and tasty hot sauce.
Great Greek food.
First time i went this weekend. What a experience. Great place that looks really nice in there! Amazing food with many options!! worth every dollar
Excellent place! Super clean, organized and good quality food!

Loved it! Their food is fresh and tastes amazing. Probably the best Greek restaurant I have been to in New York. I was seated relitavely fast which was a plus and couldn’t wait to share the amazing King plate with my brother. The King plate is a must when you go to this place. Their gyros are so juicy, their Greek sauces are all amazing, the French fries were crispy, the Bifteki is so juicy, and their sausage as well.The Greek sodas were also nice.The manager made sure we were satisfied. He went around the tables greeting all the customers. Can’t wait to come again! Keep up the good work King Souvlaki!
Delicious food!!
Small portions but really delicious!

Thought this restaurant had class. The man behind counter was disrespectful and food had no taste.
Excellent greek food. Order the lemon potatoes
Kings plates is a must try . Very friendly and fast service. Currently holding the record for finishing the kings plate in 18 minutes 36 seconds . I challenge you to beat it
Best souvlaki in town!!!First time in NYC and I loved it. There food was so delicious. Everything was fresh!!!Definatelly recommend it
Best Greek food! Always fresh and delicious!!! Restaurant looks amazing. Warm atmosphere and very friendly ownership and staff! Love it!!!!
Absolutely delicious !! The food is so fresh and is authentic Greek food. Must go if you are in the neighborhood.
The best Souvlaki 👍👍👍

I was so excited that it had finally opened here in Bay Ridge, but got disappointed cause its not the same services as the truck in Astoria. I tried to place an order over the phone this way as I drive up it would have been ready.They put me on hold and never took my order. Once I got to the store I ordered Pork Souvlaki Platter I had high expections I guess. I was given the old fries instead of the fresh ones that had just came out. I was given the end tips of the pork instead the nice meaty pieces like you get in the truck. It was early in the day around 730pm and not busy at all so its not like I went during closing time that i got the food I did. Maybe Ill wait a while till they get themselves better acclimated before "Maybe" given them another chance.

I've been going to their Astoria Queens food cart from where I live in Bensonhurst Brooklyn for many years and have always thought it was worth the trip. Very happy they opened in Bay Ridge just 10 minutes from where I live. We went there on Saturday, their second day of their GRAND OPENING. We had to wait about 10 minutes for a table, the place was packed with people eating in and getting orders to go.  Once we were seated, ordered our food and it was served, I was thrilled to taste the same exact wonderful tastes in the foods that I used to travel 30 miles to get.  The food here is fantastic, the people as friendly as can be and the prices for the quality and taste of what is served, can't be beat ANYWHERE !  Now that we're "neighbor's", they'll be seeing me much more often than they did at their Astoria food truck location.  Best of luck to all of you, you guy's deserve success ! See you soon.
The best greek place!!!!!!

I’ve been going to their food carts for a while now. Once I found out that they opened a store I immediately rushed to check their food out. Not only was it amazing but they added additional food to the menu!!

I had to come and show support for their first store opening. Good news spreads quickly about their grand opening so there was some wait time. We were seated pretty quickly, but with the volume of customers they had coming in, there was a longer than usual wait time. But once our King's Platter came out, all was forgiven. Good luck guys & keep it up 🙌

Tonight was the grand opening of the flagship store so it was super busy but the food was very good and the portions were perfect. I had the lamb gyro platter and my friend got the king plate which took a long time to come out but it was enormous! You could  def share that plate with three people and all be satisfied. I would recommend the king plate to try all that is to be offered but if you want something personal, I'd suggest the Greek fries. (Also if you like feta)
